citation.article-title: Sagittula stellata gen. nov., sp. nov., a lignin-transforming bacterium from a coastal environment.

p.s: Sagittula (Sa.git'tu.la. L. fem. n. Sagittula, small arrow, referring to the shape of the bacterium)
Cells are rod shaped, gram negative, strictly aerobic, and oxidase and catalase positive.
Each cell has a holdfast structure, and the cell envelope has numerous surface vesicles derived from the outer membrane.
Cells form rosettes and aggregates and grow on sugars, fatty acids, and amino acids.
Sea salt-based medium is required for growth.
The type species is Sagittula stellata.
